result.victor: loser: Colonists, but it was a good run

notables.fact1: Start of revolutionary war
notables.fact2: Paul Revere's midnight ride to Concord warned the people in advance
First rebel victory of the Revolutionary War

notables.fact1: British casualities over 1000, Americans only 400
notables.fact2: American General Putnam ordered: Don't fire until you see the whites of their eyes

notables.fact1: Severe defeat for Americans (outnumbered 2-1)
notables.fact2: Americans evacuate Manhattan
notables.fact3: General Washington threw his hat on the ground in anger

notables.fact1: On Christmas, surprise raid on British Hessians (German mercenaries)
notables.fact2: 1000 taken prisoner, only 6 American soldiers wounded

notables.fact1: First major American victory of the Revolutionary War
notables.fact2: 600 British casualties while American losses are only 150

notables.fact1: Bad weather and delays of the land troops resulted in failure
notables.fact2: This showed that alliance with France would not speedily end the war

notables.fact1: The worst American defeat of the Revolutionary War
notables.fact2: Charleston and the Americans' 5400-man garrison captured, British losses only 225

notables.fact1: The battle lasted a little over one hour and was an overwhelming American victory
notables.fact2: Stopped British offensive momentum in the South

notables.fact1: Americans lay siege to Yorktown until British surrender
notables.fact2: Last battle of the Revolutionary war

notables.fact1: Protected homes from lighting strikes
Offered Southern planters a justification to maintain and expand slavery
The winner was reluctant to become president due to raging debates concerning the new government
notables.fact2: The new president was careful to avoid any symbolic references to European monarchy

notables.fact1: The winner was re-elected unanimously by the Electoral College
notables.fact2: Two political parties emerged during this election, the Federalists and the Democratic-Republicans

notables.fact1: Washington refused a third term
notables.fact2: Only election cycle to elect a President and Vice President from opposing parties

other.name: Boston Massacre
other.significance: A milestone in turning colonial sentiment against British authority

other.name: Boston Tea Party
other.significance: Culmination of a resistance movement against the Tea Act (no taxation without representation)

other.name: Publication of Thomas Paine's Common Sense
other.significance: Popular pamphlet that provided strong arguments for America's independance

other.name: United States Declaration of Independance
other.significance: Announced the people's unalienable rights to life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness were being violated, justifying a revolution

other.name: Treaty of Paris
other.significance: Ended the Revolutionary War and recognized American sovereignty

other.name: Northwest Ordinance
other.significance: Established formal procedures for transforming territories into states, and includes a Bill of Rights

name: Bill of Rights
significance: List of fundamental rights of U.S. citizens and serves to protect them from government infringement

notables.fact1: Gave the Americans control of Lake Erie for the rest of the war
notables.fact2: The first unqualified defeat of a British naval squadron in history

notables.fact1: Ended British invasions of the northern United States
notables.fact2: British General Prevost, the Defender of Canada, got rekt

notables.fact1: Yes, this happened after the end of the war. Information travelled slowly.
notables.fact2: Made future president General Andrew Jackson quite popular

notables.fact1: Allowed farmers to harvest five times as quickly compared to using a scythe
Made instant communication between distant places in the country possible
Chemical process to make rubber strong and supple to create tires
Muzzle-loading rifles could be easily loaded and were now used in combat situations

elections.result: Democratic-Republican Jefferson defeated Democratic-Republican Burr, and Federalists Adams and Pinckney

notables.fact1: The winner was elected by vote of House of Representatives
notables.fact2: The top two candidates both recieved the same number of electoral votes

notables.fact1: Highest victory margin in a presidential election in which there were multiple major party candidates
notables.fact2: Under the 12th amendment, electors were required to vote for both president and vice president

notables.fact1: First of only two times the incumbent Vice President would continue to serve under a new President
notables.fact2: The winner had served as Secretary of State under Jefferson

notables.fact1: New York replaced Virginia with most electoral votes (would hold #1 spot until 1972)
notables.fact2: The closest election up to that point for the popular vote (50.4%)
notables.fact3: Testament to Democratic-Republican political domination, both candidates were of the same party

notables.fact1: Democratic-Republicans received the credit for the end of the War of 1812
notables.fact2: Indiana became a state during this election cycle

elections.result: Democratic-Republican Monroe defeated Independant J.Q. Adams

notables.fact1: The only U.S. presidential election in which a candidate ran effectively unopposed, (excluding Washington's two terms)
notables.fact2: Continuation of single party politics, known as the Era of Good Feelings

elections.result: Democratic-Republican J.Q. Adams defeated Democratic Republicans Jackson, Crawford, and Clay

notables.fact1: The winner was son of the United States' second president
notables.fact2: No candidate received a majority of the electoral vote, so the House of Representatives decided

elections.result: Democratic Jackson defeated National Republican J.Q. Adams

notables.fact1: Incumbent Vice President John C. Calhoun sided with the winning candidate
notables.fact2: The winner recieved 68.2% of Electoral votes, but only 56% of popular vote

elections.result: Democratic Jackson defeated National Republican Clay, Independant Floyd, and Anti-Masonic Wirt

notables.fact1: No longer single-party election
notables.fact2: First Democratic National Convention held in Baltimore

elections.result: Democratic Van Buren defeated Whigs Harrison, White, Webster, and Independant Mangum

notables.fact1: Only time in which a Vice Presidential election was thrown into the Senate
notables.fact2: Only race in which a major political party (the Whigs) intentionally ran several presidential candidates

elections.result: Whig Harrison defeated Democratic Van Buren

notables.fact1: Rallying under the slogan 'Tippecanoe and Tyler, too,' the winner easily defeated the old President
notables.fact2: All presidential and vice-presidential candidates had been or would become President someday

notables.fact1: The winner ran on a platform that embraced American territorial expansionism (Manifest Destiny)
notables.fact2: It was the last presidential election to be held on different days in different states
notables.fact3: Polk would annex much of Mexico

notables.fact1: The winner was not clearly committed to Whig principles, but he was popular for leading the war effort
notables.fact2: This winning candidate was the last Whig president

other.name: Louisiana Purchase
other.significance: Doubled the country's size and opened up the possibilities for westward expansion

other.name: Missouri Compromise
other.significance: Delayed and maintained the balance of the slavery debate for a short time, but did not end it

other.name: Erie Canal
other.significance: Gave the western states direct access to the Atlantic Ocean without using the Mississippi River

notables.fact1: Local residents picnicked near the battlegrounds, expecting an easy victory for the Union
notables.fact2: This battle was expected to be the first and last of the civil war

notables.fact1: Total casualties equaled over 20,000
notables.fact2: Union General Johnston was killed in this battle

notables.fact1: Single bloodiest day of the Civil War, with 23,000 casualties
notables.fact2: Union General McClellan failed to pursue the Confederate troops and was therefore replaced by General Burnside

inventions.name: Cowboy Hat
inventions.significance: This article's fabric was made without weaving, and can protect the wearer from the elements

inventions.name: (Hand-cranked) Machine gun
inventions.significance: The inventor had hoped that his powerful new weapon would discourage large scale battles and show the folly of war
